¬†I love to learn, and I dedicate at least one hour every 3 days just to learn something new or just to cement my knowledge. Most of the times I tend to spend more than 1 hour. The disadvantage of that is feeling overwhelmed by the sheer volume of information. Depending on what I learn or do, I end up struggling to find focus when it comes to time.

In order to avoid that, I use the Pomodoro Technique. And I decided that since I am a developer, I might as well make my own Pomodoro Timer. My timer has the following features to help stay focused and productive:

items: Standard Mode: This follows the classic Pomodoro method, featuring 25 minutes of focused work followed by a 5-minute break.
Long Session Mode: A custom option designed by me, allowing for 2 hours of work with a 15-minute break.
Fully customizable timer: An option to set the timer to any duration you desire, whether it's a quick 5-minute burst or a longer, focused session.

text: I wanted a simple and custom timer that uses the Pomodoro Technique. Plus, I wanted a quick option for a longer session too. The Pomodoro Technique is a simple yet powerful time management method that can help:

items: Boost Productivity: ¬†By breaking down my work into manageable chunks, I can achieve more in less time.
Increase Focus: The 25-minute work intervals encourage deep concentration, minimizing distractions.
Reduce Stress: The regular breaks prevent burnout and allows my mind to rest and recharge
Increase Motivation: Seeing tangible progress through the Pomodoro method boosted your motivation and kept me engaged.

text: It is incredibly easy to implement. Here is how:

items: Choose a task: Have in mind a specific task you wish to do.
Set a timer for 25 minutes: Focus solely on the chosen task for the entire 25 minutes.
Take a 5-minute break: Step away from your computer, stretch, and allow your mind to relax.
Repeat steps 1-3: After four Pomodoros, take a longer break of 15-20 minutes.

text: P.S. The longer session button option of my timer is my own tomato sauce I came up.

The Pomodoro Technique is a powerful tool for managing your time and boosting your productivity, especially when cultivating your work style. By incorporating this simple method into your workflow, you can create a more focused, efficient, and rewarding experience.
The Pomodoro Technique aligns perfectly with the principles of a digital garden because you can:

items: Focus on Growth: Just like a garden needs consistent care, a digital garden thrives on regular attention and focused work.
Cultivate Ideas: The breaks in the Pomodoro method provide fertile ground for new ideas to sprout and grow.
Harvest Results: The Pomodoro Technique helps you harvest the fruits of your labor, producing valuable content for your digital garden.
